Side Effects: Tired all the time can't remember anything always in a bad mood but it seems to be helping
Hair is falling out in clumps. I'm very angry- unlike my normal personality. I have severe headaches.
Comments: It HAS worked.

Side Effects: Severe mood swings_ thoughts of suicide.Punching myself repeatedly and kicking doors and anything close".
Comments: Absolute discrace is all I can say!!

Side Effects: Literally everything on the leaflet. Vomiting_ dizziness_ falling over_ walking into things_ slurred speech_memory loss_extreme vivid nightmares_ burning up_ low sex drive_ severe mood swings_ depression and suicidal thoughts etc
Comments: The side effects for me personally far outweigh the benefits having persisted with it for nearly a year the side effects only seem to get worse. That said not all drugs affect everyone the same way.

Side Effects: Unable to stand_fell_ unable to walk_slurred speech_ don't remember what I said to anyone_ extremely confused_ tired_extreme drunk feeling_ no memory.
Comments: Was really hoping the side effects would improve with time. Instead I feel like I lost 2 weeks out of my life.

Side Effects: dizziness; cognitive dysfunction - no concentration_ memory problems_ word retrieval problems; feeling dazed; extreme tiredness; sadness and crying
Stunted emotions
Comments: This is my second time taking and my second rating. I asked to be put back on Vimpat as my doctor was ready to send me to an EMU to be evaluated and mentioned possible surgery and I did not want that. Last time_ in addition to stunted emotions_  I also had personality changes. Although it helped with my seizures_ I could not handle not being "me". This time_ while I am still on Keppra_ I added B6 in addition as recommended in a seizure forum. It worked. My emotions are stunted this second time but I am not flying off the handle or getting easily irritated.  I am not thrilled with the emotion thing but at this point in my life_ I'd rather deal with that than going into an EMU and the possibility of surgery. If it should no longer control my seizures down the road_ then I will look into the EMU.

Side Effects: Memory loss_ moodiness_ anxious_ emotional_rapid weight gain
Comments: Started having small "seizures" when I started perimenopause.  I never had them before this. I was prescribed lamictal which helped a little. Vimpat was added which helped but I started having terrible side effects. Simple things like having eaten at a restaurant in the past I couldn't remember. Things told to me 2 days before I couldn't remember. Im always in a bad mood and cry over nothing. Gained almost 30 lbs since I started taking it. At first I thought I would deal with the side effects since it helped_ but now its not only affecting but my family. If someone had told me this before_ I would never have started it.

Side Effects: Severe depression with suicidal ideation_ insomnia_ nausea_ headaches_ sudden weight gain
at higher doses extreme dizziness
Comments: the drug that stopped my grand mal seizures. was still having focal seizures_ averaged every two weeks or so. tried several other add-on meds until my doc and i found the right one. haven't had a grand mall in three years.

Reason: add o  drug for uncontrolled seizure
Side Effects: PSYCHOTIC EPISODEFOLLOWED BE EXTREME FEAR_ DOUBLE VISION_ EXHAUSTION_ ATAXIA
Comments: I WAS WEANED UNDER MEDICAL SUPERVISION AND I AM NOT SPINNING  AROUND ANYMORESADLY_ SEIZURE CONTROL WAS EXCELLENT FOR A WHILETHEN I BEGAN FALLING FAINTING NEEDING STITCHES/STAPLES

Side Effects: Insomnia and weight gain

--Unable to walk due to extreme dizziness (for 2 hours after taking the drug_ I would be unable to walk -- I would need to crawl on all 4 fours to my destination.  I fell frequently because was also very off balance the remainder of the day -- my body was covered with black and blue marks--Unable to talk; slurred words (as when one gets very drunk) and unable to formulate sentences--Not effective; was experiencing 1 - 3 grand mal seizures each week--Memory became an extreme problem -- if I watched a movie in the morning I would have totally forgotten anything about it (or even having seen it) by the afternoon--Extreme depression; I'm sure part of it was simply due to my frequent seizures and the extreme side effects
Comments: l also relayed my problems to Barrows_ the epilepsy foundation and the drug manufacturer but there was no concern from any of these parties.

Side Effects: Noticed forgetfulness. Having trouble remembering little things and choosing between two things. I will need to get  one of two items and grab the wrong item. I have a hard time spelling simple words when I write.
Comments: I take 50 MG of Vimpat twice a day along with 200 MG of Lamictal and 200 MG of Zonegarn twice a day also.  I take my 2nd 50 MG of Vimpat when I go to bed at night. I seem to have my seisures at night.

Side Effects: Initially_ Vimpat seemed to be a godsend. The doctor had added it when my Keppra was not completely controlling my seizures. About two weeks ago_ I fell. Not sure what happened. Three says ago_ almost went down again. Vision difficulty for the past couple of weeks. Severe headaches. Beginning to have difficulty reading (something that was happening just before I was diagnosed with Epilepsy--it improved 100% with Keppra but now it is back again) and now_ I have started hallucinating...first auditory and now visually.  My once laid back personality has become more intense_ getting angry and irritable over nothing. My emotions are otherwise flat. Things I should feel happiness_ sadness_ joy_ etc...do not have reaction....irritability and anger are only reactions I have. This is not me.
Comments: I am disappointed this is happening_ especially after such a good start on Vimpat.

Side Effects: loss of balance_ very sleepy
Sleepy_ blood pressure increase_ heart palpitations_ balance problems.
Very vivid dreams. Often sleepy right after taking in the morning but wears off thoughout the day.
Comments: Had 1 break through seizure when I first started this medication so had to increase dosage.

Side Effects: Dizziness - at first. My doctor was the Director of Research for the VIMPAT study.  The dizziness was controlled by taking me off of an AED_ and drastically lowering the dose of 2 others. From 800 mg /d of Lamictal to 15 mg /d and from 1000 mg /d Primidone to 400 mg /d.
Comments: The only drug that worked. I had been terminally ill from epilepsy_ no medicine to treat me_ "Go home and die"_ they had said. I resorted to marijuana for a while. It works_ but being high sucks_ because you can not function in a rational world - living as a happy_ goofy_ blob is no way to live. I gave up marijuana because I hated being fckt up 24/7/365. Vimpat works. The dizziness side effects were controlled by taking me off of Keppra_ lowering by primidone to 400 mg/d_ and by lowering my lamictal to 15mg /d (going off of it). My neuro was the Director of Research for Vimpat when it was an investigational drug.

Side Effects: I was removed from Topamax and began taking Vimpat due to continued seizures.  When I began the drug_ I had horrific night panics_ headaches and increased blood pressure.
Comments: After about six months_ I acclimated to the medicine; however_ I experienced myoclonic jerks (new to me) and mental confusion about every other month which required Ativan to relieve the symptoms. I'm now titrating off Vimpat and adding Lamictal.  I'm doing much better with Lamictal with minimal side effects.  However_ once I began coming off Vimpat_ the headaches have returned with nausea...but it's worth it.  Of the three anticonvulsants I have tried_ Vimpat has the worst side effects.

Side Effects: Severe nausea_ vomiting_ dry-heaves.  I recently tried Vimpat again and 5 days into the 50 mg dose once daily (lowest possible_ I believe)_ I began having severe nausea and dry-heaves yet again.  I've never experienced this much nausea in 20 years of migraine and seizure medication.

I've probably tried every seizure drug known to man. I was sick of taking Depakote_ due to the side effects_ but my doctor told me that it was the only drug that worked good in the past "500mgs. a day". About 5 months ago she called me and told me that she wanted me to try this "Vimpat"_ needless to say_ "Praise God!"_I finally found something that works. I have never gone longer than two months without having partial seizures_ that are to me_ the most horrible. Never have I gone this long without them. I'll be due to drive again by December 2nd. Very thankful.
Hard to say- I am weaning off of Topamax and that is horrible.
Comments: I am seizure free!!

Side Effects: short-term memory problems_ depression
Comments: I took a minimal dose of Vimpat for 3 months as monotherapy. No seizures_ but began developing depression a week after starting and which got severe over next two months. When I got off_ the depression went away. Not for me.

Side Effects: Slight dizziness with my second dose increase; it was gone in a day though. Since I have been taking it_ I seem to be yawning a lot. I also feel very hot/overheated more easily. It makes me want to crank the AC. On the plus side_ I have been in a much better mood since starting the Vimpat. Things don't seem to irritate me as easily or as bad.
Comments: So far...I LOVE IT! I am also on Oxcarbazepine which seems to be controlling my Grand-mals_ but I was having frequent partials on almost every drug I took. My neuro decided to add on Vimpat to see if it would help. I have not had a seizure of any kind since starting Vimpat. He was even able to lower my dose of Oxcarbazepine without any problems. Don't be afraid to try it just because it is a newer drug.

Side Effects: hair thinning_ slight balance problems_ insomnia
Comments: My dose was increased slowly_ to see at what point the seizures would stop.  Vimpat took away about 75% of my seizures_ but I now also have to take another medicine as well.
It has controlled the seizures VERY well!!!!  I have been seizure-free for the first time in 43 years!!  I might be able to drive!!     Is a side-effect of Vimpat Urinary incontinence?

Side Effects: Dramatic increase in seizures_ sleeping or felt like sleeping_ no desire or ability to do simple tasks.
Comments: Vimpat was prescribed for my son to control a misdiagnosed seizure type.  It was thought he had partial seizures when he had myoclonic status nonprogressive epilepticus
